title: Robert Jennings (rugby league)
text:
Robert Jennings (born 2 January 1996) is a <a href="Tonga%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Tongan international</a> <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a er and for the <a href="Penrith%20Panthers">Penrith Panthers</a> in the <a href="NRL">NRL</a>.
He previously played for the <a href="Penrith%20Panthers">Panthers</a>, <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a> and the <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">National Rugby League</a>.
Background.
Jennings was born in <a href="Blacktown">Blacktown, New South Wales, Australia</a> to Tongan-born parents. He is also of Fijian and English descent. Jennings is the younger brother of former <a href="Parramatta%20Eels">Parramatta Eels</a> player <a href="Michael%20Jennings%20%28rugby%20league%29">Michael Jennings</a> and <a href="Melbourne%20Storm">Melbourne Storm</a> player <a href="George%20Jennings%20%28rugby%20league%29">George Jennings</a>, and nephew of 1960s All Black <a href="Arthur%20Jennings%20%28rugby%20union%29">Arthur Jennings</a>.
He played his junior football for the <a href="Western%20City%20Tigers">Western City Tigers</a> & <a href="Minchinbury%20Jets">Minchinbury Jets</a>, before being signed by the <a href="Penrith%20Panthers">Penrith Panthers</a>.
Playing career.
Early career.
In 2014, Jennings played for the Penrith Panthers' <a href="National%20Youth%20Competition%20%28rugby%20league%29">NYC</a> team. In November and December 2014, he played for the <a href="Australian%20Schoolboys%20rugby%20league%20team">Australian Schoolboys</a>. In 2015, he moved on to the Panthers' <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Cup">New South Wales Cup</a> team.
2015.
In round 7 of the <a href="2015%20NRL%20season">2015 NRL season</a>, Jennings made his <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a> debut for Penrith against the <a href="Gold%20Coast%20Titans">Gold Coast Titans</a>. On 2 May 2015, he played for the <a href="Junior%20Kangaroos">Junior Kangaroos</a> against <a href="Junior%20Kiwis">Junior Kiwis</a>. On 8 July 2015, he played for the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20rugby%20league%20team">New South Wales</a> Under-20s team against the <a href="Queensland%20rugby%20league%20team">Queensland</a> Under-20s team. At the time, he was contracted with Penrith until the end of 2016.
2016.
Jennings was named in Penrith's squad for the <a href="2016%20NRL%20Auckland%20Nines">2016 NRL Auckland Nines</a>.
After not receiving any game time in the <a href="2016%20NRL%20season">2016 NRL season</a>, Jennings signed a one-year contract with the <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney Rabbitohs</a> starting in 2017. In September, he was named at centre in the 2016 NYC Team of the Year.
2017.
Jennings was named in South Sydney's squad for the <a href="2017%20NRL%20Auckland%20Nines">2017 NRL Auckland Nines</a>. He made his South Sydney debut against the <a href="Manly-Warringah%20Sea%20Eagles">Manly-Warringah Sea Eagles</a> in round 2, scoring a try and setting one up for teammate <a href="Robbie%20Farah">Robbie Farah</a>.
2018.
In round 3 of the <a href="2018%20NRL%20season">2018 NRL season</a>, Jennings scored his first hat trick try for South Sydney in the 34-6 win over the <a href="Manly-Warringah%20Sea%20Eagles">Manly-Warringah Sea Eagles</a> at <a href="ANZ%20Stadium">ANZ Stadium</a>. In round 14 he scored 4 tries in the club's 42-24 smashing of the <a href="Parramatta%20Eels">Parramatta Eels</a> at <a href="ANZ%20Stadium">ANZ Stadium</a>. Jennings finished off the 2018 season with 19 tries. Jennings played in all three of the club's finals games including the 12-4 preliminary final loss against arch rivals <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Eastern Suburbs</a>.
2019.
On 21 February Jennings signed a two-year deal with the <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a> after he was released by South Sydney.
Jennings made a total of 18 appearances for the <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a> in the <a href="2019%20NRL%20season">2019 NRL season</a> as the club finished ninth on the table and missed out on the finals.
2020.
On 28 September, Jennings was one of eight players who were released by the <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a>.
2021.
On 30 October 2020, Jennings returned to <a href="Penrith%20Panthers">Penrith</a> on a one-year deal.
